alert.note: Alert for Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 9:14PM MDT until July 09 at 10:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Rosebud County in southeastern Montana... * Until 1015 PM MDT. * At 913 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 27 miles south of Edwards, or 32 miles north of Hysham, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail and wind damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Rosebud County, including the following locations... Rock Springs and Angela. This storm has a history of producing golfball hail over Musselshell county. This replaces the warning previously in effect for this area. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This thunderstorm is capable of producing all types of severe weather including extremely large hail, destructive straight line winds and tornadoes. Move quickly to a safe shelter such as an interior room, a bathroom, closet or basement.
